snippet: Eleven states argue that drafting new rules is vital to public health. But the Obama administration faces pressure from Republican critics who say that tighter air pollution rules could hurt the economy.
abstract: Eleven states argue that drafting new rules is vital to public health. But the Obama administration faces pressure from Republican critics who say that tighter air pollution rules could hurt the economy.

headline.main: States Sue E.P.A. Over Delayed Soot Rules
